| A gigantic pseudodragon:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* has no hands.
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* can be [tamed by feeding](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic").
* wanders randomly.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* [likes gold](/wiki/Gold_lover "Gold lover").
* likes gems.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                                                                                                                                          |

A **gigantic pseudodragon**, D, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"). It is a [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous") and [domestic](/wiki/Domestic "Domestic") [dragon-like](/index.php?title=Dragon_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Dragon (dNetHack) (page does not exist)") creature that is the [strongest](/wiki/Strong "Strong") of the [pseudodragons](/wiki/Pseudodragon_\(dNetHack\) "Pseudodragon (dNetHack)"). Gigantic pseudodragons are capable of [flight](/wiki/Flight "Flight"), have a tendency to wander, will pick up [gold](/wiki/Gold "Gold") and [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem"), and can be seen via [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision").

A gigantic pseudodragon has a bite attack, two claw attacks, and a [breath weapon](/wiki/Breath_weapon "Breath weapon") similar to that of [half-dragons](/wiki/Half-dragon "Half-dragon").

## Generation

Gigantic pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [huge pseudodragon](/wiki/Huge_pseudodragon "Huge pseudodragon") can [grow up](/wiki/Grow_up "Grow up") into a gigantic pseudodragon.

A gigantic pseudodragon may be generated as the guard of a [magic item vault](/wiki/Special_room_\(dNetHack\)#Magic_item_vault "Special room (dNetHack)").

## Origin

Pseudodragons originate from *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")*, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Gigantic_pseudodragon\&action=edit)*

html:
Gigantic pseudodragon

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
D gigantic pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 35
Attacks Bite 3d10 physical, Claw 3d6 physical, Claw 3d6 physical, Breath weapon 4d8 half-dragon breath
D gigantic pseudodragon (No tile)
Difficulty 35
Attacks

Bite 3d10 physical, Claw 3d6 physical, Claw 3d6 physical, Breath weapon 4d8 half-dragon breath

Base level 30
Base experience 1340
Speed 12
Base AC -6
Base MR 32
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 9000
Nutritional value 1500
Size gigantic

A gigantic pseudodragon:

  • can fly.
  • has no hands.
  • is carnivorous.
  • can be tamed by feeding.
  • wanders randomly.
  • is strong.
  • likes gold.
  • likes gems.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A gigantic pseudodragon, D, is a type of monster that appears in dNetHack and notdNetHack. It is a carnivorous and domestic dragon-like creature that is the strongest of the pseudodragons. Gigantic pseudodragons are capable of flight, have a tendency to wander, will pick up gold and gems, and can be seen via infravision.

A gigantic pseudodragon has a bite attack, two claw attacks, and a breath weapon similar to that of half-dragons.

Generation

Gigantic pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A huge pseudodragon can grow up into a gigantic pseudodragon.

A gigantic pseudodragon may be generated as the guard of a magic item vault.

Origin

Pseudodragons originate from Dungeons & Dragons, where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''gigantic pseudodragon''', {{brightblue|D}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[dNetHack]] and [[notdNetHack]]. It is a [[carnivorous]] and [[domestic]] [[Dragon (dNetHack)|dragon-like]] creature that is the [[strong]]est of the [[Pseudodragon (dNetHack)|pseudodragons]]. Gigantic pseudodragons are capable of [[flight]], have a tendency to wander, will pick up [[gold]] and [[gem]]s, and can be seen via [[infravision]].

A gigantic pseudodragon has a bite attack, two claw attacks, and a [[breath weapon]] similar to that of [[half-dragon]]s.

==Generation==
Gigantic pseudodragons are not randomly generated. A [[huge pseudodragon]] can [[grow up]] into a gigantic pseudodragon.

A gigantic pseudodragon may be generated as the guard of a [[Special room (dNetHack)#Magic item vault|magic item vault]].

==Origin==
Pseudodragons originate from ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'', where they resemble true dragons in appearance but are usually far smaller and far more docile, which makes them suitable as familiars for wizards. They do not usually grow to the sizes shown in dNetHack and notdNetHack, which rivals that of the true dragons in those variants.
